article: Why, you may wonder, should spiders be our friends? Because they destroy so many insects, and insects _ some of the greatest enemies of the human race. Insects would make _ impossible for us to live in the world. They would devour (eat up quickly) all our crops and kill our flocks and herds, were it not _ the protection we get from insect-eating animals. We _ a lot to the birds and beasts who eat insects but all of them _ together kill only a fraction of the _ destroyed by spiders. _ , unlike some of the insect eaters, spiders never do the least _ to us or our belongings. Spiders are not insects, _ many people think, _ even nearly related to them. One can tell the _ almost at a glance, _ a spider always has eight legs but an insect never more than six. How many spiders are _ in this work on our _ ? One authority _ spiders made a _ of the spiders in a grass field in the south of England, and he estimated that there were more than 2,250,000 in one acre; that is _ like 6000,000 spiders of different kinds on a football field. Spiders are busy for at least half the year in killing insects. It is _ to make more than the _ guess at how many they kill, but they are hungry creature, not _ with only three meals a day.
